title: Watch: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye address crowd at Patriots’ send-off rally
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, recovering from illness and shoulder injury, appeared at team's send-off rally in Foxborough.
Head coach Mike Vrabel credited players, especially Maye, for New England's success in reaching Super Bowl LX.
Patriots will play the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX on February 8 at Levi's Stadium, kickoff at 6:30 p.m.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Alexander Skarsgård hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Alexander Skarsgård hosted the 1,000th episode of 'Saturday Night Live', marking a milestone in the show's history.
Cardi B, the musical guest, performed on the episode, but her boyfriend Stefon Diggs did not make an appearance.
The episode featured cameos from Pete Davidson as Tom Homan and Stellan Skarsgård, who appeared twice after an Oscar nomination.

title: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and dreamed of running the Red Sox
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Scituate native Mike Macdonald, now Seahawks head coach, faces the Patriots in Super Bowl LX.
Macdonald grew up a Red Sox fan, aspiring to be their general manager due to better baseball skills.
He transitioned from playing to coaching, eventually becoming Seahawks head coach in 2024 with a 24-10 record.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots held a Super Bowl LX send-off rally at Gillette Stadium with speeches from Robert Kraft and Mike Vrabel.
The event featured a performance by the Dropkick Murphys and appearances from former Patriots players.
Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks will take place on February 8 at Levi's Stadium in California.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praises Patriots' culture and coach Mike Vrabel in pitching team to potential free agents.
Patriots set to attract free agents with Super Bowl appearance, respected leadership, and significant salary cap space.
Key free agents like George Pickens and Jaelan Phillips could bolster Patriots roster in upcoming NFL season.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams has proven valuable to the New England Patriots with 5.5 sacks in regular and postseason play this year.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal, the largest in franchise history, with $63 million guaranteed.
Williams ranked 8th among the Patriots' top 10 free-agent signings due to his impactful first season performance.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics are reportedly unlikely to pursue high-profile trades before Thursday's NBA trade deadline.
Nic Claxton of the Nets could address Celtics' big man needs, but acquiring him requires valuable assets.
Players like Daniel Gafford, Keon Ellis, and Isaiah Jackson are considered feasible trade targets for Boston.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Something in the Way Fest 2026 hosts 24 indie and alt-rock bands at Boston's Roadrunner on Jan. 31 and Feb. 1.
Explosions in the Sky delivered an emotional 90-minute instrumental set as the festival's headliner on Saturday night.
The Hotelier, among other bands, performed, showcasing the enduring loyalty of New England fans despite no recent albums.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins practiced under a tent at Raymond James Stadium to maintain ice quality for Sunday's outdoor game.
The temporary tent, with refrigeration and dehumidification units, is designed to protect the ice from Florida's weather.
Despite the effort, Sunday's temperatures are forecasted to be below average, alleviating concerns about the ice condition.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands protested in Boston Common on Jan. 31, 2026, against cooperation with ICE, urging stronger protections for immigrants.
The protest coincided with a nationwide campaign across over 300 cities, fueled by recent ICE-related deaths in Minneapolis.
Local advocacy groups organized the event, emphasizing nonviolent resistance and accountability from Massachusetts officials.
